content.text:
# Fujiwara Kyō-ke

The  was a cadet branch of the Fujiwara clan of Japan.
History
It was founded by Fujiwara no Maro
Maro had three brothers: Muchimaro, Fusasaki, and Umakai. These four brothers are known for having established the "four houses" of the Fujiwara.
See also
* Fujiwara Hok-ke
* Fujiwara Nan-ke
* Fujiwara Shiki-ke
Notes
References
* Brinkley, Frank and Dairoku Kikuchi. (1915). A History of the Japanese People from the Earliest Times to the End of the Meiji Era. New York: Encyclopædia Britannica. [https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/413099 OCLC 413099]
* Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric and Käthe Roth. (2005). Japan Encyclopedia. Cambridge: Harvard University Press. ; [http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/58053128?referer=di&ht=edition  OCLC 58053128]
